programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Charlie Stayt and Naga Munchetty present national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features. Including NewsWatch at 7.45.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt is joined by chefs Sam Evans and Shauna Guinn, and special guest Jo Brand joins the show via video link. Plus, clips from the BBC food archive.(n)

programme.title: The Great Food Guys
programme.desc: Chef Nick Nairn and Dougie Vipond focus on Scottish fruit, cooking an apple and bramble crumble with drambuie custard. Joining them are Ross Mitchell and Rosalind Erskine.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell explore properties about to be auctioned in London, Manchester and Ulverston, Cumbria, including a house which is across three floors.(n)

programme.title: Euros Rewind
programme.desc: Scotland v England. A full re-run of the Euro 96 Group A encounter at Wembley Stadium. Both sides were looking for a first victory in the competition after drawing their openers against the Netherlands and Switzerland respectively, and it was Paul Gascoigne who stole the headlines with a famous goal.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore sees what people are about to throw away at a Surrey recycling centre, rescuing two car axle stands, a farmhouse table and some rusty old railings for transformation.(n)

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: The team are in Leamington Spa to help Robert and Gemma and their daughter Darcey, who is afraid of the family's nettle-strewn, overgrown garden.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin is on a house-hunting mission with a couple who have £750,000 to break away from their London suburb and find a rural family home in North Yorkshire.(n)

programme.title: Moana
programme.desc: To save her island home from a terrible curse, a brave Polynesian teenager must set sail and journey into the great blue yonder with the aid of a legendary hero. Disney animation, with the voices of Dwayne Johnson, Auli'i Cravalho, Rachel House and Temuera Morrison.(n)

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present a writers special edition of the general knowledge quiz, with the contestants Martina Cole, Mark Billingham, Liz Pichon, Nick Sharratt, Juno Dawson, Nadia Shireen, Adam Kay and Ian McMillan.(n)

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's Big Laughs
programme.desc: The comedian looks back at some of the best moments from the Michael McIntyre's Big Show series, revisiting some of the biggest laughs from the past five seasons. Tonight, he looks back on the shocked look on Judge Rinder's face as he is woken from his sleep to play the Midnight Gameshow, and the unforgettable Send to Alls with Holly Willoughby and Jamie Oliver. The host also relives the moment Gary Barlow surprises the audience by singing along to their karaoke versions of some classic Take That songs.(n)

programme.title: Peter Crouch: Save Our Summer
programme.desc: The former footballer hosts a new variety entertainment show, featuring live music, comedy skits and a host of celebrity guests via video links. Peter will also be joined in each episode by TV and BBC Radio 1 presenter Maya Jama, as well as Taskmaster's Alex Horne and his comedy band the Horne Section.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.sub-title: Match of the Day Top Ten: International Moments
programme.desc: Gary Lineker is joined by Alan Shearer and Ian Wright to discuss the top 10 in Premier League history for a chosen category.(n)

programme.title: The Hurt Locker
programme.desc: Two American bomb disposal experts operating in Iraq are assigned a new leader after their previous one dies in action. However, the sergeant's reckless attitude and love of battle consistently puts them at risk. Kathryn Bigelow's Oscar-winning drama, starring Jeremy Renner, Anthony Mackie, Guy Pearce and Ralph Fiennes.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather. Presented by Martin Geissler and Rachel Burden.(n)

programme.title: The Andrew Marr Show
programme.desc: A round-up of the week's stories, featuring interviews with key figures in politics and current affairs and a round-up of the Sunday papers. Including news and weather at 10.00.(n)

programme.title: Politics England
programme.desc: The latest political news and debate from a regional perspective.(n)

programme.title: Sunday Worship
programme.desc: The Rev Canon Leigh Richardson leads a service for Trinity Sunday from St Davids Cathedral in Pembrokeshire. With hymns sung by a Songs of Praise congregation recorded in July 2019.(n)

programme.title: Sunday Morning Stories
programme.desc: The Rev Kate Bottley shares tales of unity, examining inspiring stories of those who came together with the goal to unite with the people around them, and work hard to make life better not just for themselves but everyone they come into contact with..(n)

programme.title: Points of View
programme.desc: Tina Daheley presents as viewers have their say on the BBC's television programmes..(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Anita Manning looks after proceedings today from two antiques centres in the Hertfordshire town of Sawbridgeworth, joined by experts John Cameron and Caroline Hawley.(n)

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher explores how music and faith can help people through the darkest of times, talking to Bishop Dr Joe Aldred about the Christian response to the death of George Floyd.(n)

programme.title: Euros Rewind
programme.desc: Wales v Slovakia. Another chance to see the Euro 2016 Group B encounter at Nouveau Stade de Bordeaux in France.(n)

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Harry and David Rich head to Yardley in Birmingham to try to fulfil the wish of a man who died of cancer before he could see his garden transformed.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jay Blades salvages three items to transform from Altrincham Recycling Centre - mattress springs, an old writing bureau and a broken granite worktop.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin is in Pembrokeshire with a couple who want not only to buy their first house together, but also need accommodation for holidaymakers and a horse.(n)

programme.title: Spy in the Wild
programme.desc: Natural history documentary in which spy cameras camouflaged as various animals go undercover in the animal world, getting up close and personal to film their behaviour. Spy Pup is immersed in wild dog life to explore their maternal love, and Spy Penguin records the turbulent action of the mating season, as a male Adelie penguin falls victim to a pebble thief that ruins his chances of love for the season. Spy Tortoise and Spy Bushbaby keep watch on chimpanzees, while in perhaps the most moving scenes, Spy Monkey becomes the focus of attention for a troop of concerned langurs who believe the motionless camera-creature has died.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Steve Brown explores Elmley Nature Reserve on the Isle of Sheppey, where swallows and swifts are gathering in their hordes, heralding the arrival of summer. Margherita Taylor is on the hunt for an invasive species of moth that threatens not just the oaks on London's Hampstead Heath, but walkers too. On his farm, Adam Henson's horses get their hooves checked and he catches up with trainer Jonjo O'Neill to see how his racehorses are coping with life off the track.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team of antiques experts visit Erddig, north Wales. On a scorching hot day, the crowds come out, bringing with them items including a dazzling emerald and diamond ring worn by the owner's grandmother on the Titanic, a Welsh love spoon carved in 1859 by a young man for his sweetheart and an avid fan's collection of James Bond props.(n)

programme.title: Killing Eve
programme.sub-title: Are You Leading or Am I?
programme.desc: Konstantin makes a break for it, while Eve and Villanelle try to work out what the future may hold for them - together or apart. Spy thriller, starring Jodie Comer, Sandra Oh and Kim Bodnia.(n)

programme.title: Alan Shearer's Euro 96: When Football Came Home
programme.desc: The former England striker looks back at the 1996 European Championships, in which he played a pivotal role in helping the host nation reach the semi-finals. Shearer meets up with teammates in the tournament Paul Gascoigne and Teddy Sheringham and manager Terry Venables to discuss their memories, and Frank Skinner and David Baddiel discuss the making of the song Three Lions.(n)

programme.title: A Question of Sport
programme.desc: Team captains Matt Dawson and Phil Tufnell are joined by four more sporting stars for the quiz hosted by Sue Barker. The panellist are England cricketer Rory Burns, who made his international debut in November 2018, British athlete Emily Diamond, who was part of the bronze medal-winning 4x400m team at Rio 2016, former swimmer Mark Foster, who competed primarily in butterfly and freestyle at 50 metres and won a gold medal at the World Short Course Championships, and former rugby league star Robbie Hunter-Paul, who played for four English clubs during a 19-year career.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Dan Walker and Louise Minchin present a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: Saving Our Nurses
programme.desc: Documentary following a mentorship scheme designed to help new nurses stay in the profession and reverse a trend in which more than a third are looking for new roles. Newly qualified nurse Lauren has reached breaking point in one of the busiest A&E departments in the UK, so mentor Taz tries to negotiate an urgent move for her to a new part of the hospital.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A return visit to a detached house in Ashford, Kent, that Lucy Alexander first saw back in 2013. Dion Dublin explores a ground-floor flat in Birmingham and Martel Maxwell looks round a two-bedroom terrace in Stoke with no kitchen or bathroom.(n)

programme.title: Fugitives
programme.desc: Fugitive hunters in Spain chase an elusive drugs kingpin who sold almost a ton of cocaine, while police in Derby want to send a convicted Polish kidnapper back home.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: David Harper and Raj Bisram help the teams look for items at Ardingly International Antiques and Collectors Fair in West Sussex, while presenter Natasha Raskin Sharp visits a windmill that has been turned into a museum of rural life.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Zara has a bright idea on how to broadcast that there is a vacancy, while Ruhma is in for a shock when she discovers why Ayesha isn't at the Mill. When a lonely elderly man loses the will to live, Jimmi gives his son some food for thought.(n)

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The clerical sleuth encounters a voodoo priest who is intent on winning back the woman he loves - no matter the cost. Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, starring Mark Williams.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman helps a woman who wants to move to rural Devon on a £450,000 budget, and also heads to the seaside town of Dawlish to join in with the carnival.(n)

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers presents a programme in which five dealers bid against one another to buy intriguing items brought in by members of the public. The opening edition features an unusual item of hairdressing memorabilia, something salvaged from a tip, a classic piece of industrial furniture and a beloved toy.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Izzie Balmer and James Braxton take a tour of south-east England, along the way encountering items including a potter's wheel, before an auction in Tring, Hertfordshire.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones presents the first visit of the week to the One Show studio, featuring the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat.(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.sub-title: Scandal at the Post Office - Panorama
programme.desc: Hundreds of sub-postmasters were jailed or financially ruined after computers said money was missing from their branches, but the Post Office has admitted that its Horizon system can make mistakes. But when did senior managers find this out, and did they continue to prosecute postmasters for stealing when they knew technology could be to blame? Reporter Nick Wallis investigates what could be Britain's biggest-ever miscarriage of justice scandal and uncovers evidence of a cover-up at the Post Office.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Ian arranges a memorial for Dennis and Sharon is touched by the effort he has put in. Gray finds Whitney disorientated on the street and takes her back to his place, where they go over the night Leo was killed. Mick and Linda have their eyes on a house to rent, but they are worried about Phil paying them with dodgy money for The Vic. Peter asks Dotty to fix his car but she refuses.(n)

programme.title: Sitting In Limbo
programme.desc: After living in the UK for 50 years, Anthony Bryan is called in by his manager at the care home where he works and told she has received a letter from the Home Office claiming that he has no right to work in the UK and is suspending him. A few months later, immigration officers arrive at Anthony's front door and he is put into a van and taken to a detention centre in Dorset. Drama inspired by a story from the Windrush scandal, starring Patrick Robinson, Nadine Marshall and Pippa Bennett-Warner.(n)

programme.title: I May Destroy You
programme.desc: Up-and-coming writer Arabella returns from visiting her boyfriend in Italy and is greeted by a deluge of frantic messages from her literary agents. With a matter of hours left to finish a draft of her second book, she plans to pull an all-nighter - but is soon tempted to join a friend on a night out. Drama exploring the question of sexual consent in contemporary life, created by and starring Michaela Coel, with Weruche Opia and Paapa Essiedu.(n)

programme.title: Peter Crouch: Save Our Summer
programme.desc: The former footballer hosts a new variety entertainment show, featuring live music, comedy skits and a host of celebrity guests via video links. Peter will also be joined in each episode by TV and BBC Radio 1 presenter Maya Jama, as well as Taskmaster's Alex Horne and his comedy band the Horne Section.(n)

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: A compilation of highlights from the pre-lockdown shows recorded earlier this year, featuring such famous faces as Miriam Margolyes, Daniel Radcliffe, Jamie Foxx, Michael B Jordan, Patrick Stewart, Robert Downey Jr, Emma Thompson, Hugh Laurie, Jim Carrey, Margot Robbie, Daniel Kaluuya, Mark Ruffalo, David Schwimmer, Oti Mabuse, Anna Kendrick and Justin Timberlake.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Dan Walker and Louise Minchin present a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: Saving Our Nurses
programme.desc: A new midwife questions whether she is cut out for her vocation when she fails to master a vital technique - but her mentor has a plan to help her perfect her skills.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts and the team explore properties about to be auctioned in the Kent seaside town of Margate, the Lancashire town of Carnforth, and a residence near Chesterfield.(n)

programme.title: Fugitives
programme.desc: The cases of a lodger who killed his landlord and fled to Ireland, a homeless man with two years to serve on a prison sentence, and a Polish drink driver on the run in London.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Philip Serrell and Tim Weeks provide advice to two teams competing at the Royal Cornwall Showground near Wadebridge. Host Anita Manning meets a surfing legend in Newquay.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Ruhma has an offer for Tanya, while Deborah tries to make friends but alienates people. A patient's suspicious behaviour worries Al, and a new receptionist starts at the Campus.(n)

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest is asked to look after Lady Felicia's wayward niece Bunty, who soon finds herself suspected of murder. Starring Mark Williams, with Emer Kenny.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson heads to south Wales with a couple who have spent three decades in military housing, and are looking for their very own country home on a budget of £430,000.(n)

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Visitors try to get a good deal on an unusual key, a harmonica, an early 20th-century underwear advert, and a Victorian silver belt. Nigel Havers presents.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Izzie Balmer and James Braxton take a tour of Northamptonshire and Bedfordshire. Items up for sale include a ring made of lava from Mount Vesuvius and depleted uranium glassware.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Gray advises Whitney to use her flashbacks to piece together what happened on the night Leo was killed. Peter organises a fitness class in the square and Dotty joins in to flirt with him, while Rainie tells Habiba she isn't interested in Max's money any more as she has Stuart.(n)

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Essie attempts to act as if there is nothing to worry about as she starts chemotherapy, but confides in Fletch that she knows they will both face difficult decisions in the future. Guy's past is dredged up, but gets the chance to prove he is better than his reputation - if he can convince Ric to let him operate. Jac is determined to secure a bright future for Darwin after losing a profitable contract, but fears her feelings for Kian may be a distraction.(n)

programme.title: The A Word
programme.desc: Rebecca pays a visit to Joe's school to teach the class about pregnancy, an experience which eases her worries about her own child's future. However, while driving back to the Lakes, she goes into labour, and faces the prospect of giving birth by the roadside with only Joe on hand to help her. Ben returns from work in Derby with bad news for Alison. Ralph moves into his new flat with Katie, and Louise finds the experience of her son leaving home hard to take - but Maurice proposes a drastic solution to her loneliness.(n)

programme.title: I May Destroy You
programme.desc: Lunch with Terry gets Arabella thinking about the hazy events of the previous night and growing increasingly desperate to put together the pieces, she drops by Simon's apartment. Meanwhile, Terry has a lousy audition, and a concerned Kwame rushes to Arabella's side.(n)

programme.title: Ambulance - Liverpool
programme.desc: The return of the award-winning documentary series following the work of the North West Ambulance Service as they care for the people of Liverpool and all across Merseyside. The shift begins with a call-out to a stabbing in a park - the 36th such incident the Merseyside teams have deal with in the past seven days. Then the medics prepare for a busy weekend as the St Patrick's Day celebrations hit the streets of Liverpool. Before long crewmates Paul and Emma are dispatched to a patient with chest pain, before treating another with a suspected broken arm. As the party gets into full swing, a call comes in from two children whose father has lost consciousness, and they have to be talked through the steps to revive him.(n)

programme.title: Killing Eve
programme.sub-title: Are You Leading or Am I?
programme.desc: Konstantin makes a break for it, while Eve and Villanelle try to work out what the future may hold for them - together or apart. Spy thriller, starring Jodie Comer, Sandra Oh and Kim Bodnia.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather. Presented by Dan Walker and Louise Minchin.(n)

programme.title: Saving Our Nurses
programme.desc: Fabie, a newly qualified nurse, struggles to cope with life in one of the busiest A&E departments, so she is moved to the surgical assessment unit to protect her mental wellbeing.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: The renovation of a semi-detached in Bilston, West Midlands, and a mid-terrace in Chatham, Kent, as well as a derelict Welsh bungalow that turned into a four-year project.(n)

programme.title: Fugitives
programme.desc: Police officers from the UK and Uganda trace a woman who fled the UK after killing her own daughter. Detectives in London search for a Romanian man hiding out in the city.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Experts Gary Pe and David Harper help two teams buy items at Southwell Racecourse in Nottinghamshire, while presenter Eric Knowles visits the Museum of Timekeeping in Newark.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Medical drama series set in a busy Midlands surgery. Sid has to help a carer in need whilst helping a new recruit to Rapid Response, while new girl Lily has a lock in at The Mill.(n)

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest struggles to promote understanding when a group of pagans are suspected of killing one of their own. Crime drama, starring Mark Williams.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson is house hunting in Somerset with a couple who have a £675,000 budget to find a rural home that must have annex potential for their parents.(n)

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers welcomes four more people with interesting items to sell, including a doll designed to teach resuscitation, and a collection of dairy artefacts.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Izzie Balmer and James Braxton head to Lincolnshire, Cambridgeshire and Bedfordshire. James tries out a local delicacy and Izzie tries her hand at a winter sport.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Magazine show, with stories of interest from around the UK, plus celebrity guests in the studio. Presented by Alex Jones and Amol Rajan.(n)

programme.title: Our Lives
programme.sub-title: Big Night at the Bingo - Our Lives
programme.desc: A look inside a bingo hall in the heart of West Belfast, meeting some of the regulars who have known each other for many years, through thick and thin. The programme follows bingo members including serenely composed Eilish, who was taught how to play by her grandmother when she was in her teens, and hard-working Margaret, who juggles her bingo alongside work, a college course, school pick-ups and supporting her husband as he deals with health problems.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and the team restore more family heirlooms, including a tired and dilapidated a rocking horse that holds huge sentimental significance for its owner and a 1930s pinball machine. Other items are a Victorian device used for measuring weather pressure and a pair of precious plates.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: The amateur sewer competition hosted by Joe Lycett continues. This time, the five remaining contestants take part in the quarter final, creating garments and trying their hand at techniques from around the world. Firstly, the sewers must follow a pattern like they have never encountered before, as judges Patrick Grant and Esme Young ask them to make a Filipino Terno Blouse. In the Transformation Challenge, the competitors are asked to turn Provencal tablecloths from France into a brand new outfit in just 90 minutes, before creating a dramatic Flamenco skirt from Southern Spain in the final challenge.(n)

programme.title: Staged
programme.desc: Comedy in which actors David Tennant and Michael Sheen play themselves as they prepare for a stage production while under lockdown. The Good Omens co-stars were due to put on a play in the West End before the production was put on hold because of the coronavirus pandemic. Not wanting to let his big break pass him by, director Simon Evans must do his best to convince his doubtful actors to carry on rehearsals online.(n)

programme.title: Staged
programme.desc: With rehearsals due to begin, director Simon goes missing. Michael and David embrace the opportunity to skive off from their duties, but one of them gets caught breaking the law. Georgia is due to deliver her novel to her agent and asks David to stand in and help with the kids.(n)

programme.title: The Mysterious Murder of Nipsey Hussle
programme.desc: Ben Zand sets out to unravel the mystery of rapper and entrepreneur Nipsey Hussle's murder, which took place in March 2019, travelling to Los Angeles to meet those closest to him.(n)

programme.title: The Truth About
programme.desc: Journalist Nikki Fox teams up with scientists at Liverpool John Moores University to discover what takeaways do to our health, what's really in them and how people can kick the habit. In a unique experiment, 15 volunteers eat nothing but takeaways for two weeks and undergo a barrage of tests, from blood sugar and body fat to gut bacteria and mental sharpness. The results reveal the shocking truth about how takeaways affect our bodies and brains.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Naga Munchetty and Charlie Stayt present national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: Saving Our Nurses
programme.desc: A nurse who recently arrived in the UK from the Philippines and is facing up to a double challenge - making a career in the NHS and a new life 7,000 miles from home.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts revisits an old church in Denby, Derbyshire, which was being turned into a home in 2007, and there are also visits to Milton Regis in Kent and Liverpool.(n)

programme.title: Fugitives
programme.desc: Extradition detectives in London search the capital for fugitives on the run from justice, and officers from Derby travel to Latvia to arrest a gang of people traffickers.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Philip Serrell and Thomas Plant help two teams at the Royal Welsh Showground in Builth Wells, Powys, while Charlie Ross finds out about a collection of vintage film posters.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Daniel tries to help Zara, while Jay opens up to Rob. Lily helps Al with a birthday plan for Jimmi. Medical drama, starring Matthew Chambers and Elizabeth Dermot Walsh.(n)

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: After suspicious circumstances surround the death of a local fighter, Father Brown is drawn into the shady world of boxing to try and uncover the truth.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Sonali Shah is house hunting with a couple who have a budget of £650,000 and want to quit the city to find a house with great entertaining potential in the Cheshire countryside. Sonali also delves into the region's manufacturing heritage at one of the country's best preserved textile mills from the Industrial Revolution.(n)

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Five dealers compete to buy items including an unusual musical instrument, a wartime phone being sold for charity, and a cake stand with cakes thrown in. Presented by Nigel Havers.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Izzie Balmer and James Braxton's penultimate leg takes them to Lowestoft and Cromer. Along the way, Izzie is charmed by a snake and an art deco necklace, while James goes crabbing and gets all fired up by a cannonball. But who will come out on top at auction in Banbury?(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest. Presented by Alex Jones and Amol Rajan.(n)

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: After a career serving all over the world, army veteran Jason, his wife Esther, and their four children have finally put down roots - but the trouble is their Suffolk garden is little more than a concrete car park. The couple have a budget of £3,000 to try to create a space where they can enjoy sitting out as a family. As the military is a big part of this family's life, they want to see the resulting garden incorporate some remembrance poppies. Charlie Dimmock and Harry and David Rich head to Stowmarket to see how they can help Jason and Esther to realise their dreams.(n)

programme.title: You Are What You Wear
programme.desc: Rylan Clark-Neal hosts a fashion makeover show, with five stylists advising a diverse range of people in need of a significant style overhaul. In the first edition they help Chris, a 6ft 5in personal hygiene salesman who only wears black, and 5ft 3in Manny, who has been wearing children's clothes for years and is looking for a grown-up style with sass. PE teacher Rachel wants to swap gym wear for glamour, while warehouse employee Karen is worried that her work wardrobe is creeping into her weekend.(n)

programme.title: Ambulance - Liverpool
programme.desc: An urgent call is made by a man whose wife is in cardiac arrest, with a doctor and paramedic team from North West Air Ambulance immediately dispatched to assist on the job. Back in control, a call is in progress for a patient suffering chest pains as a result of cocaine binge. Meanwhile out on the road, crewmates Chris and V are dispatched to a category-three call for a patient who's fallen. However, once the patient is safely treated the couple's dogs become the focus of the paramedics' attention. Narrated by Christopher Eccleston.(n)

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the topical debate, inviting a panel of politicians and other guests to answer questions from viewers at home on subjects that have made the headlines over the past week.(n)

programme.title: Newscast
programme.desc: Laura Kuenssberg, Chris Mason, Fergus Walsh and Adam Fleming present their weekly round-up from Westminster as the coronavirus pandemic continues, delivering their usual mix of serious analysis and light-hearted gossip about the biggest stories in politics.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Charlie Stayt and Naga Munchetty present a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: Saving Our Nurses
programme.desc: Newly qualified physiotherapist Esther dreads her forthcoming move from the neurology department to outpatients and the proposed switch is causing her some worrying health problems. Occupational therapist Melissa cares deeply for her patients, but her dyslexia and the demands of essential paperwork means she's losing motivation for her job.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: An update on an unusual project in Capel Le Ferne in Kent that Lucy Alexander first visited in 2009. Plus, a mid-terrace house in Liverpool and a cottage in Plaistow, east London.(n)

programme.title: Fugitives
programme.desc: Police in London search for an Italian couple wanted for slavery and extortion, and the search for a cocaine smuggler leads to an arrest in a wealthy suburb of Accra in Ghana.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt

But when did senior managers find this out, and did they continue to prosecute postmasters for stealing when they knew technology could be to blame? The programme follows bingo members including serenely composed Eilish, who was taught how to play by her grandmother when she was in her teens, and hard-working Margaret, who juggles her bingo alongside work, a college course, school pick-ups and supporting her husband as he deals with health problems.(n)

programme.desc: Philip Serrell and Thomas Plant help two teams at the Royal Welsh Showground in Builth Wells, Powys, while Charlie Ross finds out about a collection of vintage film posters.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Daniel tries to help Zara, while Jay opens up to Rob. Lily helps Al with a birthday plan for Jimmi. Medical drama, starring Matthew Chambers and Elizabeth Dermot Walsh.(n)

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: After suspicious circumstances surround the death of a local fighter, Father Brown is drawn into the shady world of boxing to try and uncover the truth.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Sonali Shah is house hunting with a couple who have a budget of £650,000 and want to quit the city to find a house with great entertaining potential in the Cheshire countryside. Sonali also delves into the region's manufacturing heritage at one of the country's best preserved textile mills from the Industrial Revolution.(n)

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Five dealers compete to buy items including an unusual musical instrument, a wartime phone being sold for charity, and a cake stand with cakes thrown in. Presented by Nigel Havers.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Izzie Balmer and James Braxton's penultimate leg takes them to Lowestoft and Cromer. Along the way, Izzie is charmed by a snake and an art deco necklace, while James goes crabbing and gets all fired up by a cannonball. But who will come out on top at auction in Banbury?(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest. Presented by Alex Jones and Amol Rajan.(n)

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: After a career serving all over the world, army veteran Jason, his wife Esther, and their four children have finally put down roots - but the trouble is their Suffolk garden is little more than a concrete car park. The couple have a budget of £3,000 to try to create a space where they can enjoy sitting out as a family. As the military is a big part of this family's life, they want to see the resulting garden incorporate some remembrance poppies. Charlie Dimmock and Harry and David Rich head to Stowmarket to see how they can help Jason and Esther to realise their dreams.(n)

programme.title: You Are What You Wear
programme.desc: Rylan Clark-Neal hosts a fashion makeover show, with five stylists advising a diverse range of people in need of a significant style overhaul. In the first edition they help Chris, a 6ft 5in personal hygiene salesman who only wears black, and 5ft 3in Manny, who has been wearing children's clothes for years and is looking for a grown-up style with sass. PE teacher Rachel wants to swap gym wear for glamour, while warehouse employee Karen is worried that her work wardrobe is creeping into her weekend.(n)

programme.title: Ambulance - Liverpool
programme.desc: An urgent call is made by a man whose wife is in cardiac arrest, with a doctor and paramedic team from North West Air Ambulance immediately dispatched to assist on the job. Back in control, a call is in progress for a patient suffering chest pains as a result of cocaine binge. Meanwhile out on the road, crewmates Chris and V are dispatched to a category-three call for a patient who's fallen. However, once the patient is safely treated the couple's dogs become the focus of the paramedics' attention. Narrated by Christopher Eccleston.(n)

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the topical debate, inviting a panel of politicians and other guests to answer questions from viewers at home on subjects that have made the headlines over the past week.(n)

programme.title: Newscast
programme.desc: Laura Kuenssberg, Chris Mason, Fergus Walsh and Adam Fleming present their weekly round-up from Westminster as the coronavirus pandemic continues, delivering their usual mix of serious analysis and light-hearted gossip about the biggest stories in politics.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Charlie Stayt and Naga Munchetty present a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: Saving Our Nurses
programme.desc: Newly qualified physiotherapist Esther dreads her forthcoming move from the neurology department to outpatients and the proposed switch is causing her some worrying health problems. Occupational therapist Melissa cares deeply for her patients, but her dyslexia and the demands of essential paperwork means she's losing motivation for her job.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: An update on an unusual project in Capel Le Ferne in Kent that Lucy Alexander first visited in 2009. Plus, a mid-terrace house in Liverpool and a cottage in Plaistow, east London.(n)

programme.title: Fugitives
programme.desc: Police in London search for an Italian couple wanted for slavery and extortion, and the search for a cocaine smuggler leads to an arrest in a wealthy suburb of Accra in Ghana.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: The red and blue teams vie at Brighton Racecourse, East Sussex, hunting for items of value with the help of experts Catherine Southon and Mark Stacey. Presenter Christina Trevanion maintains order and also shows off a tasty mystery item.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: In an extended one-off episode of the medical drama, the Mill staff members deal with the first few weeks of lockdown.(n)

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: A local writer is murdered, leaving Father Brown delving into her novel Lulu and Lucia for clues as to who might have committed such a crime.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin embarks on a high-energy house hunt in the Norfolk countryside where he helps a dynamic couple quit urban life in London and find a character family home for their £400,000 budget.(n)

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers and valuation expert Simon Bower welcome four more people with interesting items they'd like to sell. Nigel then invites the dealers to bid against one another to secure a vintage fairground game, a 19th-century Chinese inkwell, a 1950s toy pedal car and a Victorian watchman's clock.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Izzie Balmer and James Braxton tour Izzie's native Derbyshire on the final leg, where she tempts the gourmand with some local delicacies. There's a blast from the past as James is carried away by the news from the 1780s while Izzie follows in the tracks of Winston Churchill. Then, it's onwards to auction in Lincoln.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Iain Stirling host the usual mix of celebrity guests and stories about people in extraordinary circumstances.(n)

programme.title: A Question of Sport
programme.desc: Everton winger Theo Walcott, 2006 Commonwealth heptathlon champion Kelly Sotherton, Olympic silver medal-winning swimmer Jazz Carlin and Welsh rugby great Scott Quinnell join team captains Matt Dawson and Phil Tufnell and host Sue Barker on the quiz.(n)

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: Ben watches in disbelief as Susan clears his wardrobe, ditching the old clothes that remind him of his free and easy past. To make matters worse, his eldest son breaks his favourite chair, while 12-year-old Michael prepares for his first date - forcing dad into giving him a bit of advice.(n)

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee interrupts Lucy's favourite TV programme by plonking himself down next to her on the sofa, eating her chocolates and talking loudly all the way through the dialogue. But when he suddenly can't remember the name of the leading actor and his hypochondria tells him he is losing his memory, Lucy's evening is completely ruined.(n)

programme.title: The Other One
programme.desc: Comedy about two sisters, both called Catherine Walcott, who have no idea the other exists until their father dies. Cat wants to spend as much time as possible with Cathy to make up for the last 28 years and, as they were born just five days apart, decide to organise a joint birthday party. In the wake of their dad's demise, the pair struggle to find his will, while their mothers war over which family the late two-timer loved most. Stephen Tompkinson co-stars, alongside Ellie White, Lauren Socha and Rebecca Front.(n)

programme.title: Peter Kay's Car Share
programme.desc: It's John's grandmother's birthday, but he has completely forgotten to post her card. Will he be able to put things right on the journey to work? Comedy about the daily commute of supermarket employees John Redmond and Kayleigh Kitson, who have been thrown together in a company car share scheme, with each trip bringing fresh insight into their lives, as well as twists and turns in their unlikely relationship. Co-written by and starring Peter Kay and Sian Gibson, with Danny Swarsbrick.(n)

programme.title: Jason Manford's Muddle Class
programme.desc: The stand-up performer and actor presents a wealth of new material about growing up 'working class' then finding, over the years, that part of him has become 'middle class'.(n)

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's Big Laughs
programme.desc: The comedian looks back at some of the best moments from the Michael McIntyre's Big Show series, revisiting some of the biggest laughs from the past five seasons. Tonight, he looks back on the shocked look on Judge Rinder's face as he is woken from his sleep to play the Midnight Gameshow, and the unforgettable Send to Alls with Holly Willoughby and Jamie Oliver. The host also relives the moment Gary Barlow surprises the audience by singing along to their karaoke versions of some classic Take That songs.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Marrying Mum and Dad
programme.desc: Ed Petrie and guest presenter Ben Shires help three children to plan a game show-themed wedding, featuring embarrassing questions for their parents.(n)

programme.title: Wild & Weird
programme.desc: Tim Warwood and Naomi Wilkinson plays clips featuring an angry, dinosaur-like creature on the warpath and a lemming terrorising a cat.(n)

programme.title: All Over the Place
programme.desc: The most unusual places in the UK.(n)

programme.title: Blue Peter
programme.sub-title: Blue Peter: Disney Superstar and David Walliams
programme.desc: Long-running children's magazine programme.(n)

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Steve Backshall explores habitats shared by humans and dangerous creatures, and helps remove a venomous snake from the garden of a family in South America.(n)

programme.title: Forces of Nature with Brian Cox
programme.desc: The physicist goes on a grand tour of the planet to explain how the Earth's beauty is created by just a handful of forces, beginning by examining the diversity of shapes in the natural world. Off the coast of Canada, Brian explains how massive icebergs that surge down from Greenland and into shipping lanes of the Atlantic emerge due to a powerful yet infinitesimal force of nature, while revealing how honeycombs made by bees in Nepal to store their precious honey conceal a mathematical rule.(n)

programme.title: Alexander and the Terrible, Horrible, No Good, Very Bad Day
programme.desc: An 11-year-old boy has a day where everything seems to go wrong, but gets no sympathy from his family. He becomes convinced that bad things only ever happen to him, but then his parents, his brother and his sister all suffer terrible days of their own. Family comedy based on Judith Viorst's series of children's books, starring Ed Oxenbould, Steve Carell and Jennifer Garner.(n)

programme.title: Back in Time for the Factory
programme.desc: Time moves on for the volunteers from 1973 to 1976, when disco was dominating the dance floors and maxi dresses were in vogue. It was also a time of great hope for women, with the Sex Discrimination Act having just been passed and the Equal Pay Act now in force. But will the changes in the law lead to equality on the factory floor or will the workers' hopes be dashed once again?(n)

programme.title: Nadiya's British Food Adventure
programme.desc: Nadiya Hussain explores the culinary traditions of the Peak District and surrounding areas, beginning by putting her own twist on the classic Bakewell tart. She then joins Ian Barrett to learn how to make Derbyshire oatcakes, before using them as a casing for her potato and dill samosas.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: The amateur sewer competition hosted by Joe Lycett continues. This time, the six remaining contestants take part in a series of challenges as they return to the sewing room to revive the glamorous, and sometimes ridiculous style, of the 1980s. Patrick Grant and Esme Young challenge the sewers to get down to business with the trickiest pattern so far, a woman's power jacket, before they are tasked with turning high-vis workman clothes into a party outfit in the Transformation Challenge. Finally in the Made to Measure Challenge, the contestants create their own versions of a cocktail dress.(n)

programme.title: The £100K House: The Final Fix
programme.desc: Architect Piers Taylor revisits people he and Kieran Long followed as they built their homes from scratch for less than £100,000, and helps them complete their projects. Sue and Tim still need an entrance hall staircase as a centrepiece to transform their home, but they require a series of low-cost lessons to have a chance of achieving high-end results. In north-east Scotland, Marcus and Sholto want to create outbuildings to stand alongside their rural home, and Piers presents them with a design that takes inspiration from a building on the banks of Loch Doine.(n)

programme.title: Talking Pictures
programme.desc: A selection of film and television appearances made by actor and dancer Gene Kelly over the years. Narrated by Sylvia Syms.(n)

programme.title: Carousel
programme.desc: A criminal struggling to support his pregnant wife dies during a botched armed robbery, but is given the chance to return to life 15 years later to help his family and teach his daughter a valuable lesson. Adaptation of Rodgers and Hammerstein's musical, starring Gordon MacRae, Shirley Jones, Cameron Mitchell, Barbara Ruick and Gene Lockhart.(n)

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: To get some tips for completing a complex fisherman's jumper, Ruth Goodman heads to pretty Polperro, and Tessa Dunlop takes the plunge into the glamorous history of British lidos.(n)

programme.title: Hugh's Wild West
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall discovers how the people and animals of Dartmoor live alongside each other, visiting an ancient hill farm housing dozens of house martins and swallows.(n)

programme.title: Cricket: England v West Indies Greatest Matches
programme.desc: A look back at the memorable 1984 Test from Lord's. An England side containing the likes of Ian Botham and Bob Willis took on a Windies team that cemented their reputation during the series as one of the greatest of all time.(n)

programme.title: Dad's Army
programme.desc: Private Pike receives his call-up papers and unexpectedly passes his medical with flying colours, much to the horror of his mollycoddling mother. Classic comedy first aired in 1975, starring Ian Lavender, Arthur Lowe and John Le Mesurier.(n)

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo's tour reaches its final stop, Singapore, where he learns about the island city's maritime origins and the vision of the 19th-century Englishman who put it on the map. At the bar of the Raffles Hotel, he treats himself to a Singapore Sling, now a world-famous cocktail, takes a boat down the river and dines with an artist and his family in Chinatown.(n)

programme.title: Eric Clapton: Life in 12 Bars
programme.desc: Documentary profiling the blues guitarist, narrated by the man himself, as he charts his six decades in the music business, and why his insatiable desire to grow his artistic voice led him to quit a stream of successful bands, from the Yardbirds and John Mayall and the Bluesbreakers to short-lived supergroups Cream and Blind Faith. Clapton also talks about his battles with drugs and alcohol, his love for George Harrison's wife Pattie Boyd and the tragic loss of his son in an accident. Including archive interviews with BB King, George Harrison and Jimi Hendrix.(n)

programme.title: Guitar Heroes at the BBC
programme.desc: Archive footage from BBC music shows of the 1970s. Including electric performances by the Rolling Stones, Eric Clapton, David Bowie, Motorhead, Nazareth, AC/DC and George Thorogood, as well as acoustic material by Michael Chapman, Horslips and Paco de Lucia.(n)

programme.title: What We Do in the Shadows
programme.desc: A documentary crew follows the daily lives of four vampires sharing a house in New Zealand as they prepare for an annual gathering of the undead. A new member of the household introduces the bloodsuckers to modern life, but his failure to follow the laws of their kind brings his flatmates nothing but trouble. Horror comedy, directed by and starring Jemaine Clement and Taika Waititi.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: The A to Z of TV Cooking
programme.desc: John Torode's alphabetical journey through the BBC's culinary archive continues as he reaches the letter M. Jamie Oliver prepares a mozzarella and chilli salad and the Hairy Bikers cook moussaka.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: John Craven is at home in his garden, where he gives tips on what butterflies to look out for and how to get involved in a nationwide survey. He also catches up with NHS fundraiser Tom Moore to discover what role the countryside has played in his life. Shepherdess Hannah Jackson puts her two new collie pups through their first paces as working dogs, and Adam Henson turns teacher as he takes his piglets to the country's home-schooled children.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty Don adds a variety of herbs that thrive in shade to the herb garden and adds summer annuals to the cottage garden. Nick Bailey has taken a rare opportunity to design his town garden from scratch and gives tips on how to plan and lay out a path, while Carol Klein celebrates the hardy geranium and the abundance of varieties that give masses of colour to the summer garden. Plus, the programme finds a Wolverhampton couple who have created a garden full of mystery and imagination.(n)

programme.title: Landward
programme.desc: Dougie Vipond and Nick Nairn are in their own kitchens cooking with Scottish produce and Euan McIlwraith finds out how you can research the history of your own area using historic maps. Anne Lundon investigates how lockdown has impacted the National Trust for Scotland and the important work of the Air Ambulance.(n)

programme.title: Beechgrove
programme.desc: Carole Baxter and Brian Cunningham deal with viewers' homegrown questions. Carole identifies and deals with the garden Pest of the Week and Brian is back among his compost heap.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents highlights of the series, recalling his favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Nigel Slater's Middle East
programme.desc: The writer visits Iran, starting in its bustling capital Tehran, where despite the boom in fast food outlets the dishes of the past still have a place in the hearts and culture of the people. Nigel is taken to lunch at his taxi driver's house to sample a popular stew known as dizi, then ventures north to the shores of the Caspian Sea to meet those who once fished for the famous beluga caviar, but now have to find other livings since sturgeon stocks have declined. Nigel explores the varied landscape, and harvests pomegranates and saffron, two items that epitomise Middle Eastern cuisine.(n)

programme.title: A Cook Abroad
programme.sub-title: A Cook Abroad: Monica Galetti's France
programme.desc: The MasterChef: The Professionals judge embarks on a culinary road trip through the Jura region of eastern France, spending time with the area's food producers to see how their passion translates into world-class ingredients. She joins a boar hunt and faces up to the responsibility of eating meat, learns the secret of making some of the UK's favourite French cheeses and discovers an ancient profession she never knew existed. Finally, on the slopes of Mont d'Or, Monica prepares a rustic feast using produce she gathered herself.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers continue their celebration of Britain's natural larder, focusing on the food provided by British waters as they fly-fish for trout and create a selection of dishes from the produce of seas and rivers.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.sub-title: The Bat Man of Mexico: Natural World
programme.desc: Since he first kept vampire bats in his bathroom as a child, Mexican biologist and ecologist Rodrigo Medellin has dedicated his life to saving all species of the flying mammal. In this film, David Attenborough narrates his quest to save the endangered lesser long-nosed bat, which is crucial to the production of tequila as it pollinates the plants the drink is made from. Medellin tracks the bats' epic migration across Mexico - braving hurricanes, snakes, Mayan tombs and seas of cockroaches.(n)

programme.title: Talking Pictures
programme.desc: Profiles of handsome heroes and pin-ups of the silver screen, including Paul Newman, Robert Redford, Jane Russell and Marilyn Monroe. Narrated by Sylvia Syms.(n)

programme.title: Guys and Dolls
programme.desc: A gambler accepts a bet that he cannot win the heart of a strait-laced Salvation Army member. Meanwhile, his friend has to find a secret location for an illegal dice game he is organising - while also contending with the police, a mobster and a girlfriend desperate to drag him to the altar. Musical, starring Frank Sinatra, Marlon Brando and Jean Simmons. Songs include Luck Be a Lady Tonight and Sit Down You're Rocking the Boat.(n)

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.sub-title: Inside the Factory: Keeping Britain Going
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace catches up with the Heinz baked bean factory in Wigan, which has upped production to deliver almost 50 million cans in just a month, nearly double the number of tins the firm would normally sell in the same period. Operations manager John Brockley reveals how staff are keeping safe across the site, including passing through a thermal camera that automatically takes the temperature of workers as they enter the factory.(n)

programme.title: Turkey with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: The first of two programmes in which the presenter explores the country that lies at the crossroads between Europe and Asia, and discovers the dramatic changes it is undergoing. The first leg of his journey begins in Istanbul, from which he travels along the Aegean coast to the hostile border with Syria. He meets refugees trying to start a new life and a billionaire taking advantage of a property boom. He moves on into the Taurus Mountains and the Black Sea Coast, and visits a community trying to keep an ancient language alive.(n)

programme.title: Dragons' Den: Best Ever Pitches
programme.desc: Joe Lycett narrates a selection of memorable moments where members of the panel competed with each other to secure investment in a promising entrepreneur's product. Pitches featured include an umbrella dispensing machine which won the show's first ever investment, a travel toy company that all five panellists wanted a share of, and a commercial submarine business.(n)

programme.title: The Ranganation
programme.desc: Romesh Ranganathan hosts an isolation version of his topical comedy show from his garage. A diverse group of 25 members of the public drawn from all walks of life - including Romesh's mother - are invited to share their thoughts on the state of modern Britain today and the latest talking points in the media. Romesh and his outspoken and passionate focus group will be joined remotely by a selection of celebrity guests, comedians and experts, to investigate how and why the events in the news matter to people across the country.(n)

programme.title: Dave
programme.desc: Ally takes Dave with her when she attends her sister's wedding, where she is due to give the maid of honour speech. Meanwhile, Mike is trying to finalise Dave's first record deal on the very same weekend.(n)

programme.title: Dave
programme.desc: Having just signed his first record deal, Dave fights to push his own creative vision - in this case, a brand new and controversial track called Jail, which he has earmarked as his first ever release but which his record company strongly objects to.(n)

programme.title: Mayans M.C
programme.desc: Angel's emotional entanglements distract him with lives on the line, while Emily quizzes both her husband and EZ's father on where their affections lie.(n)

programme.title: Mayans M.C
programme.desc: A brutal abduction, decade-old accounts, and a corrupt clerk contribute to a hectic day for EZ Reyes as he strives to do right by his family and his gang.(n)

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the topical debate, inviting a panel of politicians and other guests to answer questions from viewers at home on subjects that have made the headlines over the past week.(n)

programme.title: Life and Birth
programme.desc: First-time mum Mini is induced three weeks early after experiencing reduced fetal movement, and with concerns growing it is ultimately decided to deliver the baby by caesarean section. Meanwhile, 19-year-old Billie-Joe has a rare twin pregnancy called TRAP Sequence, which means one of the twins hasn't developed properly and has no heartbeat. Supported by her boyfriend Josh, Billie-Joe undergoes a complex procedure at Birmingham Women's Hospital's Fetal Medicine Centre to save the life of their healthy baby.(n)

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Guy Self returns to Holby, and is now in a relationship with a former patient, a development he wishes to keep a secret from a suspicious Ric. Essie begins her second round of chemotherapy, and her friends are determined to make sure that every other aspect of her life remain as normal as possible. Max makes an announcement regarding the future of Darwin, sending Jac and Kian's relationship into new territory.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Jay Blades' Home Fix
programme.desc: Joe Swift shows how to bring a lawn back to life, AJ Rose demonstrates how easy it is to put down decking, and Jay has a tip to help keep tools tidy.(n)

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Anu and Ash live in Coventry with their cat Quinn, where their garden is currently a new build blank canvas divided into two cramped tiers. The couple want to turn it into a pet-friendly delight, inspired by the gardens and countryside they fell in love with on holidays in Tuscany, Italy. They want lots of interest for Quinn and a large inviting patio where they can entertain their friends and family. Arit Anderson and Charlie Dimmock have a £3,500 budget to make the couple's dreams come true.(n)

programme.title: RHS Chelsea Flower Show
programme.sub-title: The Best of RHS Chelsea Flower Show
programme.desc: Monty Don and Joe Swift celebrate the positive power of plants as they focus on the designers and growers striving for a better world with the creations they bring to the event. They reveal how, over the years, the show has contributed to the better promotion of the health of the planet, plants and people, and talk to Countryfile presenter Ellie Harrison and BBC correspondent Fergal Keane about the importance of gardens to mental wellbeing.(n)

programme.title: The Week in Parliament
programme.desc: A round-up of the week's proceedings in Parliament.(n)

programme.title: Sacred Wonders of Britain
programme.desc: Neil Oliver travels to Iona in the Inner Hebrides to learn about St Columba's tough brand of monasticism, and finds out how the epic journey of St Cuthbert led to the writing of the Lindisfarne Gospels and the building of Durham Cathedral. At Canterbury Cathedral, Neil discovers how the gruesome murder of Thomas Becket spurred the building of its nave, and on Glastonbury Tor in Somerset, he investigates the story of the Holy Grail, the sacred cup of everlasting life.(n)

programme.title: Chase the Case
programme.desc: Dan Walker hosts the strategic game show in which five contestants trade general knowledge for information to gain access to a case containing a secret amount of cash.(n)

programme.title: Terry and Mason's Great Food Trip
programme.desc: Broadcaster Terry Wogan and London cabbie Mason McQueen go on a culinary journey around the nation, following a route mapped out by the adventurous gourmand Samuel Chamberlain in his 1963 travelogue British Bouquet: An Epicurean Tour of Britain. They begin in the Dorset seaside town of Weymouth, where they sample lots of fresh seafood before heading to the countryside to eat Portland lamb.(n)

programme.title: Euros Rewind
programme.desc: Yugoslavia v Spain. A chance to see the Euro 2000 Group C encounter at Jan Breydel Stadium in Bruges, Belgium.(n)

programme.title: Len and Ainsley's Big Food Adventure
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott and Len Goodman head to Bradford, where the Strictly Come Dancing judge has his first taste of a Pakistani curry and samples some Latvian cuisine.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Claire Rawle and James Lewis value antiques and collectibles at St Albans Cathedral and Abbey in Hertfordshire, while Paul Martin visits nearby Knebworth House.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Ben Fogle and Kate Humble revisit dramatic events at Longleat. Kate visits the red panda maternity suite, Alfie the gorilla has surgery to address a recurring infection on his jaw, and the park goes into lockdown after reports of an escaped animal. Back in Animal Adventure, Jean Johansson checks in with keeper Kim and Orville the corn snake.(n)

programme.title: Back in Time for..
programme.sub-title: Back in Time for the Weekend
programme.desc: The Ashby-Hawkins family give up their 21st century technology and travel back in time to discover the radical transformation of our leisure time since 1950. Guided by presenter Giles Coren and social historian Polly Russell, the family's experience is underpinned by The Family Expenditure Survey, a government study which ran from the 1950s through to 1999. In the first episode, dad Rob finds out that he's expected to be handy with a tool kit, while mum Steph comes to terms with all the washing, cooking and cleaning expected of a 1950s housewife. Meanwhile, 16-year-old Daisy learns ballroom dancing courtesy of Angela Rippon, and 12-year-old Seth discovers the great outdoors.(n)

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.sub-title: Inside the Factory: Keeping Britain Going
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace catches up with workers at the Walkers Crisps factory in Leicester, which he visited in 2016, finding out how they are coping during the coronavirus crisis. He speaks to manager Carl Lewis, who reveals that in order to keep up with demand they're making big changes to their output, switching away from single packets to a situation where 90 per cent of production is now the multipacks sold in supermarkets.(n)

programme.title: Inside Monaco: Playground of the Rich
programme.desc: Fred Sirieix narrates a documentary giving an insight into the principality on the French Riviera, with access to the royal palace as well as the super-rich and those who serve them. In the first edition, director Michael Waldman explores how this extraordinary country operates, meeting everyone from Prince Albert and his staff to wealthy widow Monika Bacardi, who takes him on a tour in her chauffeur-driven classic Rolls-Royce. He also goes track side with ex-Formula One driver David Coulthard and team owner Eddie Jordan during the Monaco Grand Prix.(n)

programme.title: Comedians: Home Alone
programme.desc: Vic Reeves does his inimitable impersonation of Graham Norton, Sara Pascoe teaches yoga with her rescue dog, Reginald D Hunter gives his unique insight into conspiracy theories and Matt Berry showcases his exclusive anti-virus song. Also featuring Bob Mortimer, Tony Way, Adam Buxton and some very relaxed cats.(n)

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain hosts as James Acaster, Angela Barnes, Ed Gamble, Darren Harriott and Zoe Lyons join regular panellist Hugh Dennis to take a comic look at the news. Yet again, stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on one another.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Emily Maitlis.(n)

programme.title: A House Through Time
programme.desc: David Olusoga traces the house's fortunes in the 18th and 19th centuries. He begins by investigating the death of owner Joseph Holbrook, and discovering why his daughter was written out of the will. A later resident of the home rises to become mayor in the 1830s, but had to find a way to prevent riots that had ravaged the city years earlier from occurring again. David also delves into the life of a servant who worked in the house in the 1870s, only to leave domestic servitude for an abusive marriage, and discovers how a successful teacher who later owned the house ended up committed to an asylum.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: John Craven is at home in his garden, where he gives tips on what butterflies to look out for and how to get involved in a nationwide survey. He also catches up with NHS fundraiser Tom Moore to discover what role the countryside has played in his life. Shepherdess Hannah Jackson puts her two new collie pups through their first paces as working dogs, and Adam Henson turns teacher as he takes his piglets to the country's home-schooled children.(n)

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera

programme.title: RHS Chelsea Flower Show
programme.sub-title: The Best of RHS Chelsea Flower Show
programme.desc: Monty Don, Joe Swift and the team look at the legends and legacies that have made the Chelsea Flower Show the greatest event in the horticultural calendar. They discover what it takes to become an icon at this show, talk to the Chelsea designers and plants men and women that have broken records, won global recognition and inspired generations of gardeners. Plus, how movers and shakers from other creative fields have been influenced by their visits to the event over the years.(n)

Dad Rob and son Seth take on football legend Trevor Brooking for a game of Subbuteo in the dining room, and Daisy and mum Steph meet Sandie Shaw to discover how the decade's daring fashions reflected the growing freedoms and confidence enjoyed by the younger generation.(n)

programme.title: Springwatch
programme.desc: Chris Packham, Iolo Williams and Gillian Burke present the latest updates from the cameras set up across the country, including a portrait of the Lake District. Ecologist Ellie Harrison shares wildlife stories live from her home in the Cotswolds, and nature cameraman Raymond Besant encounters otters in the Orkney Islands.(n)

programme.title: A House Through Time
programme.desc: David Olusoga explores the house's history from the 1880s to the First World War, a period that saw the property sliding down the social scale and turning from a family home to a multiple occupancy. He discovers how a resident responded to the death of his baby daughter by opening a milk bar for the temperance movement, only to get into legal trouble for watering down his product. David also discovers the story behind a mysterious occupant who lived in the house under a pseudonym and learns how the battle of Passchendaele changed the residents' lives forever.(n)

Cameras examine the new leader's dramatic commitment to end extremism and to return to moderate Islam. Travelling from Eastern Europe to India, and across the bloody battlefields of Syria and Yemen, it traces the impact that huge amounts of Saudi cash and weapons have had around the world.(n)

To test the sewers' handling skills, judges Patrick Grant and Esme Young kick off the pattern challenge with a boned basque. The task requires sewing together small pattern pieces for a precise fit and creating a tricky hook and eye fastening. Next, in the transformation challenge, the sewers transform pyjamas and nightwear into a summer dress, before finally being tasked to create a two-piece female sleep set which has to incorporates lace somewhere in their design.(n)

programme.desc: The Ashby-Hawkins family strut into the 1970s and some discover there were unexpected upsides to the economic and political turmoil the decade is often remembered for. programme.title: Cardinal
programme.desc: When a new victim is found, it becomes increasingly clear that the murderer's main targets are not the victims themselves, but their loved ones. Police work to establish a link between the two deaths, but crucial information continues to elude them. Meanwhile, John and Liz grow closer as they focus on the case. Crime thriller, based on the John Cardinal Mysteries series by Canadian author Giles Blunt, starring Billy Campbell, Karine Vanasse, Glen Gould and Kristen Thomson.(n)

programme.title: Cardinal
programme.desc: Another abduction hits painfully close to home for Lise, as she and John race against time to save the next victim before it is too late. programme.desc: Paul Murton visits some of the most beautiful and remote spots in Britain, meeting the people who live there and discovering more about Scotland's best-kept secrets. In this episode, he visits the low-lying islands that face the full might of the Atlantic Ocean.(n)

Hundreds of the richest people in the Kingdom, including 11 members of the Royal Family, were kept in a luxurious five-star hotel. The senior citizens also head to Chennai, where Zandra is reunited with a friend from 40 years ago and Henry relives some difficult memories of his last overseas broadcast at the city's famous cricket ground. Back in Puducherry, John and Duncan test their fitness by jumping on their bikes, while Paul, revelling in the chaos of the Indian roads, decides to take his mock Indian driving test.(n)

Chris Packham is in the New Forest, Iolo William is in the heart of west Wales, and Gillian Burke is at the Beaver project near her home in Cornwall. In this first episode, they are joined by guest presenter Steve Backshall at his home on the banks of the Thames. Plus, Michaela Strachan calls live from South Africa to present some of her favourite moments from past series.(n)

In Belfast, Adrian road-tests the largest hydraulic crane in the world and helps park a 100-metre-long Dutch cargo ship. Mehreen goes kayaking on Strangford Lough to see how the currents of the UK's largest sea inlet is placing the area at the forefront of renewable energy research. Plus, Helen Skelton tests the waters of the North Channel, one of the most dangerous swims in the world, and local comedian Shane Todd visits a long-established bespoke racing-car factory.(n)

programme.title: Atlantic: The Wildest Ocean on Earth
programme.desc: Cillian Murphy narrates a documentary examining the lives of animals and people pitting themselves against the world's wildest ocean, unveiling the natural forces that underpin life in the Atlantic, from the world's most powerful currents, ferocious hurricanes and huge chains of undersea volcanoes. The first episode looks at the influence of the Gulf Stream, with whales, giant turtles and jellyfish riding the huge current that becomes a migration super-highway and helps warm northern Europe, while fishermen battle for survival in mountainous seas as they try to exploit its natural fertility.(n)

programme.desc: Strategic game show hosted by Dan Walker, in which five contestants trade general knowledge for information to gain access to a case containing a secret amount of cash.(n)

programme.desc: The Ashby-Hawkins family embrace the 1980s, where TV and shopping dominated the UK's leisure time. It's also the decade where technology arrives in homes in a significant way. When dad Rob is not trying out the kids' CB radio, he's going shopping for a Don Johnson makeover with fashion guru Caryn Franklin.(n)

programme.desc: The team is given a presentation on the rules of sexual conduct and consent, after which Mattie, Benji and Jack head out for the afternoon determined to keep out of trouble. However, a chance supermarket meeting with a woman who wants them to meet her son Stuart leads to an unfortunate misunderstanding. As Stuart threatens to go public with his side of the story, Mattie and the others try to placate him with an all-access visit to the training complex to meet the team. programme.title: House of Saud: A Family at War
programme.desc: Examining how Saudi Arabia's most revered family stays in power, featuring interviews with those who have worked for Saudi princes. They describe how the wealth allowed lives of privilege and pleasure out of the spotlight. But the growth of social media has meant Saudis are getting increasing insight into the behaviour of their rulers, including their transgressions.(n)

programme.title: Dragons' Den: Best Ever Pitches
programme.desc: Joe Lycett narrates a compilation of some of the most memorable moments from the past 17 series of the business ideas contest, featuring Dragons past and present getting to grips with ingenious inventions and bizarre money-making schemes. The show recalls some of the harshest dismissals, but also the times when entrepreneurs got the chance to make their dream a reality.(n)

programme.title: A House Through Time
programme.desc: David Olusoga traces the history of an 18th-century sea captain's house near Bristol's docks with links to the slave trade. Bristol was a major port in the transportation of slaves from Africa's Guinea Coast to the Caribbean, and both the man who built the house and its first full-time resident were heavily involved in the trade. David uncovers stories of piracy, abandoned babies, a household slave who made a daring escape from the property, and a protest on the doorstep as the abolitionist movement gained momentum.(n)

programme.title: Jay Blades' Home Fix
programme.desc: Jay shares creative and money-saving tips and tricks for the home and garden, including how to build a floating desk and upholster an old stool. Plus, Sarah Moore demonstrates a way to recycle old jars, and Monty Don shares a fantastic method of making a raised bed for the garden.(n)

programme.title: Saving Our Nurses
programme.desc: A nurse who recently arrived in the UK from the Philippines and is facing up to a double challenge - making a career in the NHS and a new life 7,000 miles from home.(n)

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Five dealers compete to buy items including an unusual musical instrument, a wartime phone being sold for charity, and a cake stand with cakes thrown in. Presented by Nigel Havers.(n)

programme.desc: Michael Portillo explores British Columbia, discovering how two superpowers nearly came to war over a pig and joining the Royal Canadian Navy to firefight on board the frigate HMCS Regina. He also explores the rich British heritage and colonial past of Victoria - the provincial capital of British Columbia - discovers the origins of the Hudson's Bay Company, helps to carve a 36- foot totem pole and learns how to head off a charging bear.(n)

programme.title: Atlantic: The Wildest Ocean on Earth
programme.desc: Documentary examining the animals pitting themselves against the world's wildest ocean, unveiling the natural forces that underpin life in the Atlantic. In the vast South Atlantic, huge pods of dolphins, massive penguin colonies and the largest gathering of marine mammals on Earth pack chains of extraordinary islands, created by powerful volcanic forces far below them. Meanwhile, the nutrient-rich upwellings create profusions of life in some areas, and the abyssal depths host a world of bizarre creatures in others.(n)

programme.title: Chase the Case
programme.desc: Strategic game show hosted by Dan Walker, in which five contestants trade general knowledge for information to gain access to a case containing a secret amount of cash.(n)

programme.title: Terry and Mason's Great Food Trip

The pair also call in at a train shed that is now home to a flourishing food market, before popping across to Whitstable to sample its lesser-known delicacy of whelks. At Kent's county cricket ground Mason has a go at leather on willow, before everything stops for tea.(n)

programme.title: Euros Rewind
programme.desc: Hungary v Portugal. A chance to see the Euro 2016 Group F encounter at Parc Olympique Lyonnais.(n)

Ainsley heads to the kitchen and cooks a mouth-watering Portuguese chicken inspired by the day's adventures.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
